definition: an ethnic group in ancient northern China
strong-smelling vegetable (garlic etc)/non-vegetarian food (meat, fish etc)/vulgar/obscene
congee/gruel/porridge/CL:碗[wan3]

sentences.english: The main activities of Huangdi were in the North, which was related to the battles against Hunzhou and Chiyou.
sentences.chinese: 黄帝主要活动在北方，与抗荤粥和战蚩尤有关。

definition: Zhou Dynasty term for a northern nomadic tribe later called the Xiongnu 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2] in the Qin and Han Dynasties
an ethnic group in ancient northern China/also written 葷粥|荤粥[Xun1 yu4]
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Quanrong, Zhou Dynasty ethnic group of present-day western China
Yemaek, ancient ethnic group of Manchuria and Korea, precursors of Korean Goguryeo kingdom
generic term for weapons (old)/army (matters)/military affairs
surname Rong
name of a state and its people in Shangdong in late Spring and Autumn period
Wiman Korea (195-108 BC), historical kingdom in Manchuria, Liaoning and North Korea
muntjac/grammar particle indicating nonsense (classical)
Qiang ethnic group of northwestern Sichuan/surname Qiang
variant of 羌[qiang1]
Baiyue, generic term for southern ethnic groups
tribes under the Yellow Emperor
Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
